author: MSNBC.com
title: BLM NY chairman outlines proposed reforms, says Cuomo agenda too moderate
description: Hawk Newsome, chairman of Black Lives Matter of Greater NY, discusses his organizations proposed "I Can't Breathe Act" and calls for the disbanding of police unions.

author: MSNBC.com
title: NBC News / WSJ poll: Trump trails Biden in national matchup by 7 points
description: Joe Biden leads President Donald Trump 49% to 42% in a national election matchup, according to the latest NBC News/WSJ poll.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Activists paint 'defund the police' next to 'Black Lives Matter' outside White House
description:
Ali Vitali reports from Washington D.C., where protesters have painted "defund the police" next to "Black Lives Matter" on the street that leads to the White House. 

D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser had the latter message painted on Friday. The street is where prote…

title: Velshi: At George Floyd's memorial in New York, I saw the 'strength of the human spirit'
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi reflects on the profound moment when mourners recited Nelson Mandela’s favorite poem, “Invictus,” as they crossed the Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Sheriff says community doesn't 'trust us when they see us in a uniform, because we're black'

title: Velshi: As journalists, our job is to hold power accountable

title: Sen. Tammy Duckworth: I am ashamed Barr is our attorney general

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'Charlottesville had to reclaim its narrative' after Unite the Right rally 3 years ago
description: Amanda Golden reports from Charlottesville, where Charlottesville Police Chief Rashall Brackney talks about lessons learned from the Unite the Right rally 3 years ago and how the city had to "reclaim its narrative" following the event.

title: Democrats must learn ‘to beat Trump at his own game’ expert says

title: Pittsburgh journalists of color taken off Floyd protest coverage

title: Sen. Romney: ‘We need to stand up and say, Black Lives Matter’
description: Sen. Mitt Romney, R-Utah, walked with Black Lives Matter protesters in Washington, D.C. Romney said, “We need many voices against racism” as he joined thousands in a peaceful demonstration.
